meanings.definition: An instrument used for measuring angles of elevation or inclination.
meanings.sent1: I used the clinometer to measure the steepness of the hill.
meanings.sent2: The surveyor relied on the clinometer to calculate the angle of the slope.
meanings.sent3: The clinometer and I had a competition to see who could measure the steepest angle.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a clinometer, always assessing the world from different angles.
meanings.sent5: The clinometer's needle danced as it determined the angle of the tree's lean.

meanings.definition: A tool used to determine the angle of an object with respect to the horizontal plane.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter adjusted the clinometer to find the exact angle of the roof.
meanings.sent2: Students in the physics lab used a clinometer to measure the angle of the ramp.
meanings.sent3: The clinometer and the level had a disagreement about which tool was more accurate.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a clinometer, always seeking the right perspective on things.
meanings.sent5: The clinometer's reading confirmed the precise angle of the tower's tilt.
